org.smooks.api.memento

Interface MementoCaretaker

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultMementoCaretaker

    public interface MementoCaretaker
    Manages Mementos on behalf of Visitors.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void capture(Memento memento)
      Stores a copy of a VisitorMemento.
      boolean exists(Memento memento) 
      void forget(Fragment<?> fragment)
      Removes all Mementos bound to the Fragment parameter.
      void forget(Memento visitorMemento)
      Removes the VisitorMemento having an ID equal to the VisitorMemento parameter's ID as returned by Memento.getAnchor().
      void restore(Memento memento)
      Mutates a Memento to match the state of a saved VisitorMemento.
      <T extends Memento>
      T      		 stash(T defaultMemento, Function<T,T> function)
      Invokes a Consumer with a restored VisitorMemento and then saves the VisitorMemento.

    • Method Detail

      • capture

        void capture(Memento memento)
        Stores a copy of a VisitorMemento. It is the client's responsibility to remove the saved VisitorMemento once it is no longer needed either by calling forget(Fragment) or forget(Memento).
        Parameters:
        memento - the VisitorMemento to copy and store. After saving, mutations to this VisitorMemento should not alter the saved copy.

      • restore

        void restore(Memento memento)
        Mutates a Memento to match the state of a saved VisitorMemento. The VisitorMemento parameter is restored from a saved VisitorMemento having an ID equal to its ID as returned by Memento.getAnchor(). The VisitorMemento parameter remains unchanged if no such saved VisitorMemento exists.
        Parameters:
        memento - the VisitorMemento to restore

      • exists

        boolean exists(Memento memento)

      • forget

        void forget(Memento visitorMemento)
        Removes the VisitorMemento having an ID equal to the VisitorMemento parameter's ID as returned by Memento.getAnchor().
        Parameters:
        visitorMemento - the VisitorMemento to be removed

      • forget

        void forget(Fragment<?> fragment)
        Removes all Mementos bound to the Fragment parameter.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the fragment

      • stash

        <T extends Memento> T stash(T defaultMemento,
                            Function<T,T> function)
        Invokes a Consumer with a restored VisitorMemento and then saves the VisitorMemento. This method offers a convenient way to aggregate and save data instead of writing: 
         mementoCaretaker.restore(visitorMemento);
 // add data to visitorMemento
 // ...
 mementoCaretaker.save(visitorMemento);
        Parameters:
        defaultMemento - the VisitorMemento to be restored
        function - the function acting on the restored VisitorMemento and returning a new VisitorMemento replacing the earlier memento
        See Also:
        restore(Memento), capture(Memento)
